greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If n = p_1^e_1 * ... * p_k^e_k, p_1 < ... < p_k primes, then a(n) = n/p_1^e_1, with a(1) = 1.
comment: Together with A067029 is useful for defining sequences that are multiplicative with a(p^e) = f(e), as recurrences of the form: a(1) = 1 and for n > 1, a(n) = f(A067029(n)) * a(A028234(n)). - _Antti Karttunen_, May 29 2017
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: a[n_] := n / Power @@ First[FactorInteger[n]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 84}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 12 2012 *)
program: a028234 n = n `div` a028233 n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 27 2013
(PARI) a(n) = {my(f = factor(n)); if (#f~, f[1, 1] = 1); factorback(f);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 11 2016
return 1 if n==1 else n/(min(f)**f[min(f)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 12 2017
(Scheme) (define (A028234 n) (/ n (A028233 n))) ;; Needs also code from A020639 and A028233. - _Antti Karttunen_, May 29 2017
(GAP) a := List(List(List(List([1..10^3], Factors), Collected), i -> i[1]), j -> j[1]^j[2]);;
results.author: _Marc LeBrun_
ext: Edited name to include a(1) = 1 by _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jan 27 2018
